title: Red Coats and Rebels (History US).pdf
description:
Redcoats and Rebels: The American Revolution Through British Eyes
W.W. Norton & Company | 1990 | ISBN: 039302895X | English | 424 pages | PDF | 63.8 MB


The story of this war has usually been told in terms of a conflict between blundering British generals and their rigidly disciplined red-coated troops on the one side and heroic American patriots in their homespun shirts and coonskin caps on the other. In this fresh, compelling narrative, Christopher Hibbert portrays the realities of a war that raged the length of an entire continentÃ¢â‚¬â€a war that thousands of George Washington's fellow countrymen condemned and that he came close to losing. Based on a wide variety of sources and alive with astute character sketches and eyewitness accounts, Redcoats and Rebels presents a vivid and convincing picture of the "cruel, accursed" war that changed the world forever
